intro: Campanula punctata var. takesimana, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
